Community members and others shared their thoughts during the Feb. 25 Community Voices event!
“Simply Amazing” students and staff were honored at Feb. 24 Board of Directors meeting!
Congratulations to the Arlington School Board for being named a Board of Distinction!
Teachers received nearly $10,000 in mini grants from the Arlington Education Foundation!

p.br:
Working together with the leadership of AEA and PSE, we have negotiated how to address the working condition impacts of COVID-19. For AEA, a Memo of Understanding has been approved and for PSE, Frequently Asked Questions have been developed. Given the evolving nature of the current health situation, monitoring the impacts is an ongoing process. Thank you to everyone for remaining patient and flexible during these unprecedented times.
Previous Updates

a.title: Instructions for using electronic calendar
a.span:
Instructions for using electronic
calendar system

div.div:
District news
During this difficult time, we wanted to make sure you are aware of resources that are available to you. Our Teaching and Learning Department has compiled a list of important community resources such as:
• Arlington Community Food Bank
• Arlington Community Resource Center
• Displaced/Homeless Students
• Crisis Connections
• Important Phone Numbers
• Meals
• School Counselors
• Snohomish County Safe Place
• Unemployment
The full list can be found here:
Community Resources
The district also utilizes SafeSchools Alert, a tip reporting service that allows students, staff, families and community members to submit safety concerns to our administration in five different ways:
1. App: Search for “SafeSchools Alert” in the App Store to download for free
2. Phone: 844.241.1346
3. Text: Text your tip to 844.241.1346
4. Email: 1348@alert1.us
5. Web: http://1348.alert1.us
You can report any safety issue you're concerned about through SafeSchools Alert. When you submit a tip, be sure to use our district’s identification code (1348) in your communication.
Every SafeSchools Alert tip received by our district is immediately logged in the system and our administration is notified so that they can investigate and take appropriate action. Tips may also be submitted anonymously if you prefer.
Arlington Public Schools makes meal distribution site changes
Starting on Monday, April 20, Arlington Public Schools is establishing a new meal distribution site at Jordan River Trails and removing another site at Sweetwater Homes. The Jordan River Trails site is adjacent to the clubhouse located in the community. Jordan River Trails is far distant from the center of the district, and may present difficulties for students in reaching the nearest existing site at Arlington High School.
The Sweetwater Homes site is being discontinued due to the low participation at the site. Children currently receiving meals at the site located at Sweetwater Homes can continue to receive meals at any other site within the district. The following two sites are within walking distance of Sweetwater Homes:
- 62nd Ave NE and 200 Pl NE.
- Mobile Estates of 67th Ave NE.
Meals at Presidents Elementary and Arlington High School can be picked up between 10:30 a.m. and 12:30 p.m. Breakfast and lunch meals can be picked up at the following mobile locations between 9:45 a.m. and 11:45 a.m.
Lutheran Church in Silvana (1717 Ole Larson Rd)
Arlington Heights Community Club
Oso Fire Station
Bryant Community Grange (across from Bryant Store)
Angel of the Winds Casino South Parking Lot
Sisco Heights Church (McElroy Rd)
Kent Prairie Elementary School
Mobile Estates (off 67th Ave NE in Arlington)
High Clover @ 47th Ave and High Clover Blvd
Trafton General Store
Rivercrest (207th St NE/61st Ave NE
62nd Dr. NE/200th PL NE
Jordan River Trails
Heartland Homes (196th Pl. NE/45th Dr. NE)
Pioneer Elementary School
On Fridays, the Arlington Community Food Bank will be providing weekend meals for all students at all sites as part of their “Meals ‘til Monday” Program.
In order to help us identify how many meals to prepare for each location, we are asking families to complete the following form:
Meal Distribution Form
Additional information is available on Arlington Public Schools' Coronavirus (COVID-19) page at this link.

br.br:
The Strategic Plan states our mission and outlines goals in four goal areas: Student Learning and Achievement; Safe and Caring Environment; Resource Stewardship; and Parent and Community Partnerships. Each goal identifies actions and metrics for measuring progress.
Mission: Arlington Public Schools educates all students, preparing and inspiring them to graduate and seek their full potential as lifelong learners.
Motto: Educate - Prepare - Inspire
Strategic Plan
